buys.news_summary: AT&T Inc. (NYSE:T) share price return of 81% over three years lags the market return in the same period. Earnings per share (EPS) drop 12% per year, so it's unlikely the market is judging the company based on earnings growth.

news.headline: The three-year decline in earnings might be taking its toll on AT&T (NYSE:T) shareholders as stock falls 4.4% over the past week
news.summary: AT&T Inc. (NYSE:T) share price return of 81% over three years lags the market return in the same period. Earnings per share (EPS) drop 12% per year, so it's unlikely the market is judging the company based on earnings growth
news.article_text:
Investors can buy low cost index fund if they want to receive the average market return. But in any diversified portfolio of stocks, you'll see some that fall short of the average. For example, the AT&T Inc. (NYSE:T) share price return of 81% over three years lags the market return in the same period. Having said that, the 24% increase over the past year is good to see.

While this past week has detracted from the company's three-year return, let's look at the recent trends of the underlying bus

news.headline: Tutor Perini (TPC): Evaluating Valuation Ahead of Earnings Surge and Renewed Analyst Optimism
news.summary: projections call for its earnings per share to increase by approximately 150% compared to the same quarter last year. With shares still trading well below analyst price targets and an impressive turnaround projected in the company’s bottom line, the real question now is whether Tutor Perini remains undervalued
news.article_text:
Tutor Perini (TPC) is drawing attention ahead of its next earnings announcement, as projections call for its earnings per share to increase by approximately 150% compared to the same quarter last year.

See our latest analysis for Tutor Perini.

Over the past year, Tutor Perini’s momentum has ebbed and flowed, with investor attention recently focused on its latest earnings potential. While the 1-year total shareholder return stands at a modest 1.3%, its share price has gradually climbed to $62.4

news.headline: Is Construction Partners (ROAD) Stock Outpacing Its Construction Peers This Year?
news.summary: Construction Partners (ROAD) has gained 43.2% so far this year. The Construction sector has returned an average of 8.1% on a year-to-date basis. Construction Partners belongs to the Building Products - Miscellaneous industry. Tutor Perini (TPC)
news.article_text:
Investors interested in Construction stocks should always be looking to find the best-performing companies in the group. Has Construction Partners (ROAD) been one of those stocks this year? A quick glance at the company's year-to-date performance in comparison to the rest of the Construction sector should help us answer this question.

news.headline: Is It Worth Investing in AT&T (T) Based on Wall Street's Bullish Views?
news.summary: AT&T currently has an average brokerage recommendation (ABR) of 1.88, on a scale of 1 to 5 (Strong Buy to Strong Sell), calculated based on the actual recommendations (Buy, Hold, Sell, etc.) made by 30 brokerage firms. An ABR of
news.article_text:
The recommendations of Wall Street analysts are often relied on by investors when deciding whether to buy, sell, or hold a stock. Media reports about these brokerage-firm-employed (or sell-side) analysts changing their ratings often affect a stock's price. Do they really matter, though?

Let's take a look at what these Wall Street heavyweights have to say about AT&T (T) before we discuss the reliability of brokerage recommendations and how to use them to your advantage.

news.headline: Meet the Suspicious 8: Dividends Over 6% With Plenty of Problems
news.summary: Call them the Suspicious 8—the small number of S&P 500 companies with dividend yields over 6%. While they throw off lots of cash, there may be better long-term strategies.
